     - 1.4.4 If the page contains a Constant Volume Depletion (CVD) PROPERTIES table:
       - You put into this category If you see Pressure as row and Physical Properties as column (No composition)
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you find the following Column name in the page, make it to the key as follows
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Column Name | Key
       --------|-----------
       Total Recovery (mole %) | cumulative_moles_removed
       Liq. Density (g/cc) | oil_density

        Example JSON:

      {
          "sample_name": ..., # Put sample ID here
          "experiments": [
              {
                  "sample_name": ...,
                  "saturation_pressure_type": "Dewpoint", # Or Bubblepoint. If you see Pb then bubblepoint, Pd then dewpoint. If not mentioned, leave null
                  "name": "Constant Volume Depletion",
                  "type": "CVD",
                  "temperature": 106.0,
                  "temperature_unit": "C",
                  "pressure_unit": "psia",
                  "oil_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_viscosity_unit": "...", # "cP"
                  "relative_oil_volume_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "incremental_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "cumulative_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"

                  # Properties data
                  "stages": [
                      # Fill here if the table displays properties as row and pressure as column, or otherwise
                      {
                          "pressure": 4661.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": true, # Put true if it mention Psat or Pd or Pb beside pressure value
                          "relative_oil_volume": 0.0,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null, # "%"
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 0.0,
                          "oil_density": null,
                          "gas_z_factor": 0.922,
                          "gas_specific_gravity": null,
                          "gas_density": 0.339,
                          "gas_viscosity": 0.042,
                          "gas_plus_fraction_mw": null,
                      },
                      {
                          // Other stages ...
                      }
                      {
                          "pressure": 1300.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": false,
                          "relative_oil_volume": 13.18,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null,
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 67.06,
                          "oil_density": 0.63,
                          "gas_z_factor": 0.874,
                          "gas_specific_gravity": null,
                          "gas_density": 0.075,
                          "gas_viscosity": 0.015,
                          "gas_plus_fraction_mw": null,
                      }
                  ]
              }
          ]
      }

     - 1.4.5 If the page contains a Multi-Stage Separator (MSS) or Three Stage Separator table:
       - If you see "Two Stage", "Three Stage", "Four Stage" Separator, it is MSS. But, "Single Stage" is NOT MSS
       - It has 3 main parts: Liberated gas data, Final stage oil data, and properties data
          - Liberated gas data: If you see component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Stock tank oil data: If the title mention stock tank or tank oil
          - Properties: If you see pressure as row and physical properties as column (no composition)

       - This is how you put your data
          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key
          - Stock tank oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always
          - Properties or stage data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

       - If you see both First part and Second part in one table, combine them into the specified JSON.
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you see "Pressure Atm. bara", it means "pressure": 1 (atmospheric pressure means 1 bara)
       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Refer to this keyword and JSON key
       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as MSS. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Keyword | Fluid Type
       --------|-----------
       gas deviation factor (column) | gas_z_factor
       gas gravity incremental* | gas_specific_gravity

       * in "Gas Gravity" column if you find "incremental (Air=1)" and "cumulative (Air=1)", take the "incremental" and put to "gas_specific_gravity" key in JSON

        Exception:
       - If you find page with title "Bo and GOR from Three Stage Separator test during depletion using the results from Differential Liberation ...", DO NOT extract the data.

     - 1.4.6 If the page contains a Differential Liberation (DLE) COMPOSITION:
	   - You put the page in this category if you see keywords "Differential Liberation" and chemical component
       - There are 2 data types:
          - Liberated gas data: If you see keyword "Liberated gas", component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Residual oil data: If mention residual oil or final stage
	   - NOTE: These 2 data type are separated from each other

     - This is how you put your data

          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Liberated gas data
            "liberated_gas_compositions": {
              "components": [],
              "stages": []
            }
          }
          ```

          - Residual oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Residual oil data
            "residual_oil_composition": {
              "components": []
            }
          }
          ```

       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as DLE. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

        JSON STRUCTURE:

       ### Liberated gas structure:

{

                "temperature_unit": "F",
                "dle_experiment_type": "Standard DLE Experiment",

                # // First part, Liberated gas
                "liberated_gas_compositions": {
                    "components": [
                        {
                            "input_name": "N2",
                            "mw": null
                        },
                        {
                            // Other components MW
                        },
                        {
                            "input_name": "C7+",
                            "mw": 114.01
                        }
                    ],
                    # Fill here if the table displays component as row and pressure as column, or otherwise
                    "stages": [
                        {
                            "stage_number": 0,
                            "composition": [
                                {
                                    "stage_number": 0,
                                    "component_name": "C1",
                                    "molar_amount": 0.6859 # Composition in mole percent
                                },
                                {
                                    // Other components MW
                                },
                                {
                                    "stage_number": 0,
                                    "component_name": "n-C5",
                                    "molar_amount": 0.0085
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        {
                            // Other stages ...
                        },
                        {
                            "stage_number": 9,
                            "composition": [
                                {
                                    "stage_number": 9,

                                },
                                {
                                    // Other components MW
                                },
                                {
                                    "stage_number": 9,
                                    "component_name": "n-C5",
                                    "molar_amount": 0.0629
                                }
                            ]
                        }
                    ]
                }
			}
		]
	}

     - 1.4.7 If the page contains a Differential Liberation (DLE) PROPERTIES table:
       - You put into this category If you see Pressure as row and Physical Properties as column (No chemical composition)
       
       - This is how you put your data:
         MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

            "type: "DLE",
            // Properties data
            "stages": {
            }
          }
          ```     

       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Refer to this keyword and JSON key
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         
                   
       - If you see "MASS BALANCE" in title, DO NOT extract it as DLE. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Keyword | Fluid Type
       --------|-----------
       gas deviation factor (column) | gas_z_factor
       Bg | gas_fvf
       gas gravity incremental* | gas_specific_gravity
       gas-oil ratio solution** | gor

       * in "Gas Gravity" column if you find "incremental (Air=1)" and "cumulative (Air=1)", take the "incremental" and put to "gas_specific_gravity" key in JSON
       ** in "Gas-Oil Ratio" column if you find "solution" and "liberated", take the "solution" and put to "gor" key in JSON

     - 1.4.8 If the page contains a Viscosity experiment (VISCO) table:
       - Identify measurement units for parameters.
       - Viscosity table has pressure as y-axis and viscosities as x-axis
       - Extract viscosity data and structure into "experiments".
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

2. If any summary data or descriptive information is found:
   - Include it as key "Other_information", outside the "experiments" key in JSON.

   Example JSON:
   {
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio": 100,
       "separator_volume_factor": 300,
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio_unit": "scf/stb",
       "separator_volume_factor_unit": "bbl",
       ......
   }

3. Finally, you must stick to the following units

Unit shown | Unit in JSON
--------|-----------
g/cc | g/cm3
mole% | %
Vol/Vol | Sm3/Sm3
scf/sep bbl | scf/bbl
kg/Sm3 | kg/m3
psi | psia
Air=1 | SG

4. If you find Figure in the page, DO NOT extract any data from it. Just extract the title into json.

  {
    "figure_title": "Plot of dewpoint pressure"
  }

  DO NOT EXTRACT ANY DATA FROM FIGURE AND EXCLUDE FROM EXPERIMENTS.

5. If you find page mentioning "mass balance calculations" or "mass balance", DO NOT extract any data from it. Just extract like this.

  {
    "mass_balance": "1.01" # sample name as value
  }

  DO NOT CONFUSE MASS BALANCE WITH DIFFERENTIAL LIBERATION (DLE) OR MULTI STAGE SEPARATION (MSS) EXPERIMENT OR COMPOSITIONAL PAGE

6. Dealing with Paraffinic-Naphtenes-Aromatics (PNA) composition

In some cases, PNA can be reported in compositional table, DLE liberated gas, or MSS liberated gas.

For example:

| Component         | Mole % | Weight % | Molecular weight (g/mol) |
|-------------------|--------:|----------:|---------------------------:|
| n-Pentane         | 0.236   | 0.806     | 72.15 |
| Hexanes, C6 total | 0.273   | 1.087     | 84.2  |
| n-Hexane          | 0.086   | 0.351     | 86.2  |
| iso-Paraffins     | 0.154   | 0.627     | 86.2  |
| Naphthenes        | 0.033   | 0.109     | 70.1  |
| Heptanes, C7 total| 0.199   | 0.837     | 88.9  |
| n-Heptane         | 0.014   | 0.067     | 100.2 |
| iso-Paraffins     | 0.038   | 0.181     | 100.2 |
| Naphthenes        | 0.116   | 0.476     | 86.6  |

            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       - If the columns like this: 2600 psia, 2010 psia, 1000 psia, Residual Oil
          - Put the pressures columns inside Liberated Gas schema
          - Put the Residual Oil column inside Final Stage Oil schema

       - Liberated Gas structure:
          - Put each of the "pressure" inside "stages" key
          - Put ALL the "components" and its "molar_amount" inside each "pressure" which it refers to

     - 1.4.4 If the page contains a Constant Volume Depletion (CVD) PROPERTIES table:
       - You put into this category If you see Pressure as row and Physical Properties as column (No composition)
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you find the following Column name in the page, make it to the key as follows
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Column Name | Key
       --------|-----------
       Total Recovery (mole %) | cumulative_moles_removed
       Liq. Density (g/cc) | oil_density

        Example JSON:

      {
          "sample_name": ..., # Put sample ID here
          "experiments": [
              {
                  "sample_name": ...,
                  "saturation_pressure_type": "Dewpoint", # Or Bubblepoint. If you see Pb then bubblepoint, Pd then dewpoint. If not mentioned, leave null
                  "name": "Constant Volume Depletion",
                  "type": "CVD",
                  "temperature": 106.0,
                  "temperature_unit": "C",
                  "pressure_unit": "psia",
                  "oil_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_viscosity_unit": "...", # "cP"
                  "relative_oil_volume_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "incremental_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "cumulative_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"

                  # Properties data
                  "stages": [
                      # Fill here if the table displays properties as row and pressure as column, or otherwise
                      {
                          "pressure": 4661.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": true, # Put true if it mention Psat or Pd or Pb beside pressure value
                          "relative_oil_volume": 0.0,

     - 1.4.5 If the page contains a Multi-Stage Separator (MSS) or Three Stage Separator table:
       - If you see "Two Stage", "Three Stage", "Four Stage" Separator, it is MSS. But, "Single Stage" is NOT MSS
       - It has 3 main parts: Liberated gas data, Final stage oil data, and properties data
          - Liberated gas data: If you see component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Stock tank oil data: If the title mention stock tank or tank oil
          - Properties: If you see pressure as row and physical properties as column (no composition)

       - This is how you put your data
          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key
          - Stock tank oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always
          - Properties or stage data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

       - If you see both First part and Second part in one table, combine them into the specified JSON.
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you see "Pressure Atm. bara", it means "pressure": 1 (atmospheric pressure means 1 bara)
       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Refer to this keyword and JSON key
       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as MSS. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Keyword | Fluid Type
       --------|-----------
       gas deviation factor (column) | gas_z_factor
       gas gravity incremental* | gas_specific_gravity

       * in "Gas Gravity" column if you find "incremental (Air=1)" and "cumulative (Air=1)", take the "incremental" and put to "gas_specific_gravity" key in JSON

        Exception:
       - If you find page with title "Bo and GOR from Three Stage Separator test during depletion using the results from Differential Liberation ...", DO NOT extract the data.

     - 1.4.6 If the page contains a Differential Liberation (DLE) COMPOSITION:
	   - You put the page in this category if you see keywords "Differential Liberation" and chemical component
       - There are 2 data types:
          - Liberated gas data: If you see keyword "Liberated gas", component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Residual oil data: If mention residual oil or final stage
	   - NOTE: These 2 data type are separated from each other

     - This is how you put your data

          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Liberated gas data
            "liberated_gas_compositions": {
              "components": [],
              "stages": []
            }
          }
          ```

          - Residual oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Residual oil data
            "residual_oil_composition": {
              "components": []
            }
          }
          ```

       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as DLE. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

                        {
                            "input_name": "N2",

                        },
                        {
                            // Other components MW
                        },
                        {

                            "mw": 114.01
                        }
                    ],
                    # Fill here if the table displays component as row and pressure as column, or otherwise
                    "stages": [
                        {
                            "stage_number": 0,
                            "composition": [
                                {
                                    "stage_number": 0,
                                    "component_name": "C1",
                                    "molar_amount": 0.6859 # Composition in mole percent
                                },
                                {
                                    // Other components MW

            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

2. If any summary data or descriptive information is found:
   - Include it as key "Other_information", outside the "experiments" key in JSON.

   Example JSON:
   {
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio": 100,
       "separator_volume_factor": 300,
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio_unit": "scf/stb",
       "separator_volume_factor_unit": "bbl",
       ......
   }

3. Finally, you must stick to the following units

Unit shown | Unit in JSON
--------|-----------
g/cc | g/cm3
mole% | %

            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       - If the columns like this: 2600 psia, 2010 psia, 1000 psia, Residual Oil
          - Put the pressures columns inside Liberated Gas schema
          - Put the Residual Oil column inside Final Stage Oil schema

       - Liberated Gas structure:
          - Put each of the "pressure" inside "stages" key
          - Put ALL the "components" and its "molar_amount" inside each "pressure" which it refers to

     - 1.4.4 If the page contains a Constant Volume Depletion (CVD) PROPERTIES table:
       - You put into this category If you see Pressure as row and Physical Properties as column (No composition)
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you find the following Column name in the page, make it to the key as follows
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Column Name | Key
       --------|-----------
       Total Recovery (mole %) | cumulative_moles_removed
       Liq. Density (g/cc) | oil_density

        Example JSON:

      {
          "sample_name": ..., # Put sample ID here
          "experiments": [
              {
                  "sample_name": ...,
                  "saturation_pressure_type": "Dewpoint", # Or Bubblepoint. If you see Pb then bubblepoint, Pd then dewpoint. If not mentioned, leave null
                  "name": "Constant Volume Depletion",
                  "type": "CVD",
                  "temperature": 106.0,
                  "temperature_unit": "C",
                  "pressure_unit": "psia",
                  "oil_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_viscosity_unit": "...", # "cP"
                  "relative_oil_volume_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "incremental_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "cumulative_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"

                  # Properties data
                  "stages": [
                      # Fill here if the table displays properties as row and pressure as column, or otherwise
                      {
                          "pressure": 4661.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": true, # Put true if it mention Psat or Pd or Pb beside pressure value
                          "relative_oil_volume": 0.0,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null, # "%"
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 0.0,
                          "oil_density": null,
                          "gas_z_factor": 0.922,
                          "gas_specific_gravity": null,
                          "gas_density": 0.339,
                          "gas_viscosity": 0.042,
                          "gas_plus_fraction_mw": null,
                      },
                      {
                          // Other stages ...
                      }
                      {
                          "pressure": 1300.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": false,
                          "relative_oil_volume": 13.18,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null,
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 67.06,
                          "oil_density": 0.63,
                          "gas_z_factor": 0.874,
                          "gas_specific_gravity": null,
                          "gas_density": 0.075,
                          "gas_viscosity": 0.015,
                          "gas_plus_fraction_mw": null,
                      }
                  ]
              }
          ]
      }

     - 1.4.5 If the page contains a Multi-Stage Separator (MSS) or Three Stage Separator table:
       - If you see "Two Stage", "Three Stage", "Four Stage" Separator, it is MSS. But, "Single Stage" is NOT MSS
       - It has 3 main parts: Liberated gas data, Final stage oil data, and properties data
          - Liberated gas data: If you see component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Stock tank oil data: If the title mention stock tank or tank oil
          - Properties: If you see pressure as row and physical properties as column (no composition)

       - This is how you put your data
          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key
          - Stock tank oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always
          - Properties or stage data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

       - If you see both First part and Second part in one table, combine them into the specified JSON.
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you see "Pressure Atm. bara", it means "pressure": 1 (atmospheric pressure means 1 bara)
       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Refer to this keyword and JSON key
       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as MSS. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Keyword | Fluid Type
       --------|-----------
       gas deviation factor (column) | gas_z_factor
       gas gravity incremental* | gas_specific_gravity

       * in "Gas Gravity" column if you find "incremental (Air=1)" and "cumulative (Air=1)", take the "incremental" and put to "gas_specific_gravity" key in JSON

        Exception:
       - If you find page with title "Bo and GOR from Three Stage Separator test during depletion using the results from Differential Liberation ...", DO NOT extract the data.

     - 1.4.6 If the page contains a Differential Liberation (DLE) COMPOSITION:
	   - You put the page in this category if you see keywords "Differential Liberation" and chemical component
       - There are 2 data types:
          - Liberated gas data: If you see keyword "Liberated gas", component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Residual oil data: If mention residual oil or final stage
	   - NOTE: These 2 data type are separated from each other

     - This is how you put your data

          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Liberated gas data
            "liberated_gas_compositions": {
              "components": [],
              "stages": []
            }
          }
          ```

          - Residual oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Residual oil data
            "residual_oil_composition": {
              "components": []
            }
          }
          ```

       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as DLE. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

                        },

                        }
                    ],
                    # Fill here if the table displays component as row and pressure as column, or otherwise

                        {
                            "stage_number": 0,
                            "composition": [
                                {
                                    "stage_number": 0,
                                    "component_name": "C1",

            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

2. If any summary data or descriptive information is found:
   - Include it as key "Other_information", outside the "experiments" key in JSON.

   Example JSON:
   {
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio": 100,
       "separator_volume_factor": 300,
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio_unit": "scf/stb",
       "separator_volume_factor_unit": "bbl",
       ......
   }

3. Finally, you must stick to the following units

Unit shown | Unit in JSON
--------|-----------
g/cc | g/cm3
mole% | %
Vol/Vol | Sm3/Sm3
scf/sep bbl | scf/bbl
kg/Sm3 | kg/m3
psi | psia
Air=1 | SG

6. Dealing with Paraffinic-Naphtenes-Aromatics (PNA) composition

In some cases, PNA can be reported in compositional table, DLE liberated gas, or MSS liberated gas.

For example:

     - 1.4.4 If the page contains a Constant Volume Depletion (CVD) PROPERTIES table:
       - You put into this category If you see Pressure as row and Physical Properties as column (No composition)
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you find the following Column name in the page, make it to the key as follows
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Column Name | Key
       --------|-----------
       Total Recovery (mole %) | cumulative_moles_removed
       Liq. Density (g/cc) | oil_density

        Example JSON:

      {
          "sample_name": ..., # Put sample ID here
          "experiments": [
              {
                  "sample_name": ...,
                  "saturation_pressure_type": "Dewpoint", # Or Bubblepoint. If you see Pb then bubblepoint, Pd then dewpoint. If not mentioned, leave null
                  "name": "Constant Volume Depletion",
                  "type": "CVD",
                  "temperature": 106.0,
                  "temperature_unit": "C",
                  "pressure_unit": "psia",
                  "oil_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_viscosity_unit": "...", # "cP"
                  "relative_oil_volume_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "incremental_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "cumulative_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"

                  # Properties data
                  "stages": [
                      # Fill here if the table displays properties as row and pressure as column, or otherwise
                      {
                          "pressure": 4661.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": true, # Put true if it mention Psat or Pd or Pb beside pressure value
                          "relative_oil_volume": 0.0,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null, # "%"
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 0.0,
                          "oil_density": null,
                          "gas_z_factor": 0.922,
                          "gas_specific_gravity": null,
                          "gas_density": 0.339,
                          "gas_viscosity": 0.042,
                          "gas_plus_fraction_mw": null,
                      },
                      {
                          // Other stages ...
                      }
                      {
                          "pressure": 1300.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": false,
                          "relative_oil_volume": 13.18,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null,
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 67.06,

     - 1.4.5 If the page contains a Multi-Stage Separator (MSS) or Three Stage Separator table:
       - If you see "Two Stage", "Three Stage", "Four Stage" Separator, it is MSS. But, "Single Stage" is NOT MSS
       - It has 3 main parts: Liberated gas data, Final stage oil data, and properties data
          - Liberated gas data: If you see component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Stock tank oil data: If the title mention stock tank or tank oil
          - Properties: If you see pressure as row and physical properties as column (no composition)

       - This is how you put your data
          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key
          - Stock tank oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always
          - Properties or stage data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

       - If you see both First part and Second part in one table, combine them into the specified JSON.
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you see "Pressure Atm. bara", it means "pressure": 1 (atmospheric pressure means 1 bara)
       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Refer to this keyword and JSON key
       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as MSS. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Keyword | Fluid Type

       gas gravity incremental* | gas_specific_gravity

     - 1.4.6 If the page contains a Differential Liberation (DLE) COMPOSITION:
	   - You put the page in this category if you see keywords "Differential Liberation" and chemical component
       - There are 2 data types:
          - Liberated gas data: If you see keyword "Liberated gas", component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Residual oil data: If mention residual oil or final stage
	   - NOTE: These 2 data type are separated from each other

     - This is how you put your data

          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Liberated gas data
            "liberated_gas_compositions": {
              "components": [],
              "stages": []
            }
          }
          ```

          - Residual oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Residual oil data
            "residual_oil_composition": {
              "components": []
            }
          }
          ```

       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as DLE. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

2. If any summary data or descriptive information is found:
   - Include it as key "Other_information", outside the "experiments" key in JSON.

   Example JSON:
   {
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio": 100,
       "separator_volume_factor": 300,
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio_unit": "scf/stb",
       "separator_volume_factor_unit": "bbl",
       ......
   }

3. Finally, you must stick to the following units

Unit shown | Unit in JSON
--------|-----------
g/cc | g/cm3
mole% | %
Vol/Vol | Sm3/Sm3
scf/sep bbl | scf/bbl
kg/Sm3 | kg/m3
psi | psia
Air=1 | SG

4. If you find Figure in the page, DO NOT extract any data from it. Just extract the title into json.

  {
    "figure_title": "Plot of dewpoint pressure"
  }

  DO NOT EXTRACT ANY DATA FROM FIGURE AND EXCLUDE FROM EXPERIMENTS.

5. If you find page mentioning "mass balance calculations" or "mass balance", DO NOT extract any data from it. Just extract like this.

  {
    "mass_balance": "1.01" # sample name as value
  }

  DO NOT CONFUSE MASS BALANCE WITH DIFFERENTIAL LIBERATION (DLE) OR MULTI STAGE SEPARATION (MSS) EXPERIMENT OR COMPOSITIONAL PAGE

6. Dealing with Paraffinic-Naphtenes-Aromatics (PNA) composition

In some cases, PNA can be reported in compositional table, DLE liberated gas, or MSS liberated gas.

For example:

| Component         | Mole % | Weight % | Molecular weight (g/mol) |
|-------------------|--------:|----------:|---------------------------:|
| n-Pentane         | 0.236   | 0.806     | 72.15 |
| Hexanes, C6 total | 0.273   | 1.087     | 84.2  |
| n-Hexane          | 0.086   | 0.351     | 86.2  |
| iso-Paraffins     | 0.154   | 0.627     | 86.2  |
| Naphthenes        | 0.033   | 0.109     | 70.1  |
| Heptanes, C7 total| 0.199   | 0.837     | 88.9  |
| n-Heptane         | 0.014   | 0.067     | 100.2 |
| iso-Paraffins     | 0.038   | 0.181     | 100.2 |
| Naphthenes        | 0.116   | 0.476     | 86.6  |
| Aromatics         | 0.030   | 0.112     | 78.1  |

You see for every C6 total and C7 total, there are iso-Paraffins (P), Naphthenes (N), and Aromatics (A).

Remove these PNA, so you just have C6 total and C7 total.

| Component         | Mole % | Weight % | Molecular weight (g/mol) |
|-------------------|--------:|----------:|---------------------------:|
| n-Pentane         | 0.236   | 0.806     | 72.15 |
| Hexanes, C6 total | 0.273   | 1.087     | 84.2  |
| Heptanes, C7 total| 0.199   | 0.837     | 88.9  |

   - 1.2 If the page consists of table of contents
     - Put each table title from the list in key "table_title"
     - Identify the "keyword" in the table title, into these categories
        - If mention composition then "composition"
        - If mention constant composition expansion or constant mass expansion then "CCE"
        - If mention constant volume depletion then "CVD"
        - If mention differential liberation expansion then "DLE"
        - If mention multistage separator then "MSS"
        - If mention viscosity then "VISCO"
     - Identify the "sample_name" from keywords like Cylinder, Sample, Chamber number, or if it is sample pair
     - Identify the "page_number"

     - 1.4.1 If the page consists of an Information table or descriptions:
       - Extract physical parameters and values into a structured JSON format.

            - If mention "Reservoir Fluid", set "sample_fluid_type": "Reservoir Fluid"
            - If mention "BHS Water", set "sample_fluid_type": "BHS Water"
            - If mention "Separator Liquid", set "sample_fluid_type": "SEPO"
            - If mention "Separator Gas", set "sample_fluid_type": "SEPG"  
       - Classify the page into "appendix" and "transfer_sheet" key:
            - If mention "Appendix", set "appendix": true. Otherwise, false.
            - If mention "Transfer Sheet", set "transfer_sheet": true. Otherwise, false.     
       - Identify if the title contains "Sample No.", "Cylinder No.", "Chamber No.", or "Bottle No."
         - If found, set "sample_name" accordingly.
         - If not found, set "sample_name" to null.

       - If you find "density of stock tank oil", put into key "flashed_oil_density", then fill "flashed_oil_density_unit"
       - If you see gas oil ratio (GOR), put into key "recombined_fluid_gor", then fill "recombined_fluid_gor_unit

     - 1.4.3 If the page contains a Constant Composition Expansion (CCE) or Constant Mass Expansion (CME) table:
       - Identify measurement units for parameters.
       - Always put as "CCE" not "CME"
       - Extract data and structure into the "experiments" JSON key.
       - Stages 'order' key must always start from 0
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         
       - If you find the following Column name in the page, make it to the key as follows    

       Column name | Key
       --------|-----------
       Relative Volume (column) | relative_total_volume
       Relative Volumes (Vs/Vs,BP) | relative_total_volume
       RLD (column) | relative_oil_volume
       % Liq/Sat (Vliq/Vsat) | relative_oil_volume

       Note: relative_oil_volume always null BEFORE the saturation_pressure=True

       - You must stick to the following units

        Variable | Unit
        --------|-----------
        relative_total_volume_unit | Vtot/Vsat

       - Please Read the WHOLE COLUMNS of TABLE
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |

          - Put the Residual Oil column inside Final Stage Oil schema

          - Put each of the "pressure" inside "stages" key
          - Put ALL the "components" and its "molar_amount" inside each "pressure" which it refers to

     - 1.4.4 If the page contains a Constant Volume Depletion (CVD) PROPERTIES table:
       - You put into this category If you see Pressure as row and Physical Properties as column (No composition)
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you find the following Column name in the page, make it to the key as follows
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Column Name | Key
       --------|-----------
       Total Recovery (mole %) | cumulative_moles_removed
       Liq. Density (g/cc) | oil_density

        Example JSON:

      {
          "sample_name": ..., # Put sample ID here
          "experiments": [
              {
                  "sample_name": ...,
                  "saturation_pressure_type": "Dewpoint", # Or Bubblepoint. If you see Pb then bubblepoint, Pd then dewpoint. If not mentioned, leave null
                  "name": "Constant Volume Depletion",
                  "type": "CVD",
                  "temperature": 106.0,
                  "temperature_unit": "C",
                  "pressure_unit": "psia",
                  "oil_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_density_unit": "...", # "g/cm3", "kg/m3"
                  "gas_viscosity_unit": "...", # "cP"
                  "relative_oil_volume_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "incremental_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"
                  "cumulative_moles_removed_unit": "...", # "%"

                  # Properties data
                  "stages": [
                      # Fill here if the table displays properties as row and pressure as column, or otherwise
                      {
                          "pressure": 4661.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": true, # Put true if it mention Psat or Pd or Pb beside pressure value
                          "relative_oil_volume": 0.0,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null, # "%"
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 0.0,
                          "oil_density": null,
                          "gas_z_factor": 0.922,
                          "gas_specific_gravity": null,
                          "gas_density": 0.339,
                          "gas_viscosity": 0.042,
                          "gas_plus_fraction_mw": null,
                      },
                      {
                          // Other stages ...
                      }
                      {
                          "pressure": 1300.0,
                          "is_saturation_pressure": false,
                          "relative_oil_volume": 13.18,
                          "incremental_moles_removed": null,
                          "cumulative_moles_removed": 67.06,
                          "oil_density": 0.63,
                          "gas_z_factor": 0.874,
                          "gas_specific_gravity": null,
                          "gas_density": 0.075,
                          "gas_viscosity": 0.015,
                          "gas_plus_fraction_mw": null,
                      }
                  ]
              }
          ]
      }

     - 1.4.5 If the page contains a Multi-Stage Separator (MSS) or Three Stage Separator table:
       - If you see "Two Stage", "Three Stage", "Four Stage" Separator, it is MSS. But, "Single Stage" is NOT MSS
       - It has 3 main parts: Liberated gas data, Final stage oil data, and properties data
          - Liberated gas data: If you see component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Stock tank oil data: If the title mention stock tank or tank oil
          - Properties: If you see pressure as row and physical properties as column (no composition)

       - This is how you put your data
          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key
          - Stock tank oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always
          - Properties or stage data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

       - If you see both First part and Second part in one table, combine them into the specified JSON.
       - Extract data and structure into "experiments".
       - If you see "Pressure Atm. bara", it means "pressure": 1 (atmospheric pressure means 1 bara)
       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Refer to this keyword and JSON key
       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as MSS. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       Keyword | Fluid Type
       --------|-----------
       gas deviation factor (column) | gas_z_factor
       gas gravity incremental* | gas_specific_gravity

       * in "Gas Gravity" column if you find "incremental (Air=1)" and "cumulative (Air=1)", take the "incremental" and put to "gas_specific_gravity" key in JSON

        Exception:
       - If you find page with title "Bo and GOR from Three Stage Separator test during depletion using the results from Differential Liberation ...", DO NOT extract the data.

     - 1.4.6 If the page contains a Differential Liberation (DLE) COMPOSITION:
	   - You put the page in this category if you see keywords "Differential Liberation" and chemical component
       - There are 2 data types:
          - Liberated gas data: If you see keyword "Liberated gas", component as row and pressure as column (composition), and if mention vapour
          - Residual oil data: If mention residual oil or final stage
	   - NOTE: These 2 data type are separated from each other

     - This is how you put your data

          - Liberated gas data: Put component name and pressure inside "components" key, and molar amount of each component for each pressure in "stages" key

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Liberated gas data
            "liberated_gas_compositions": {
              "components": [],
              "stages": []
            }
          }
          ```

          - Residual oil data: MAKE SURE to put inside "experiments" always

          ```
          "experiments": {
            "type: "DLE",
            // Residual oil data
            "residual_oil_composition": {
              "components": []
            }
          }
          ```

       - If you see "Continuance", it means the table is continued from last page, put into key "continued": true
       - Put any information outside the table into the JSON schema, e.g. you find "Density of residual oil" put to "average_residual_oil_density" inside "experiments"
       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   Pressure    |   parameter1  |
            |   600         |   0.6         |
            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |
            |   500         |   0.8         |
            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         

       - If you see "Mass Balance" in title, do not extract it as DLE. See Instruction No. 5 below
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       - Never come up with new structures or keys, just fill up in the specified JSON schema.
       - Refer to this keyword and JSON key
       - Here is how to identify Saturation Pressure ("is_saturation_pressure" key) for CCE:
            - If the pressure column contains label "P_BP", "Psat", "Dewpoint", or "Bubblepoint", set "is_saturation_pressure": true. 
            - P_RES (reservoir pressure) is not saturation pressure. If pressure is labeled P_RES (reservoir pressure), then set "is_saturation_pressure": false
            - Saturation pressure CANNOT be more than one. Must be only one pressure with "is_saturation_pressure": true

            Example: Here 400 is saturation pressure, while 550 is not

            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |         
                   
       - If you see "MASS BALANCE" in title, DO NOT extract it as DLE. See Instruction No. 5 below

       ** in "Gas-Oil Ratio" column if you find "solution" and "liberated", take the "solution" and put to "gor" key in JSON

2. If any summary data or descriptive information is found:
   - Include it as key "Other_information", outside the "experiments" key in JSON.

   Example JSON:
   {
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio": 100,
       "separator_volume_factor": 300,
       "solution_gas_oil_ratio_unit": "scf/stb",
       "separator_volume_factor_unit": "bbl",
       ......
   }

3. Finally, you must stick to the following units

Unit shown | Unit in JSON
--------|-----------
g/cc | g/cm3
mole% | %
Vol/Vol | Sm3/Sm3
scf/sep bbl | scf/bbl
kg/Sm3 | kg/m3
psi | psia
Air=1 | SG

4. If you find Figure in the page, DO NOT extract any data from it. Just extract the title into json.

  {
    "figure_title": "Plot of dewpoint pressure"
  }

  DO NOT EXTRACT ANY DATA FROM FIGURE AND EXCLUDE FROM EXPERIMENTS.

5. If you find page mentioning "mass balance calculations" or "mass balance", DO NOT extract any data from it. Just extract like this.

  {
    "mass_balance": "1.01" # sample name as value
  }

  DO NOT CONFUSE MASS BALANCE WITH DIFFERENTIAL LIBERATION (DLE) OR MULTI STAGE SEPARATION (MSS) EXPERIMENT OR COMPOSITIONAL PAGE

6. Dealing with Paraffinic-Naphtenes-Aromatics (PNA) composition

In some cases, PNA can be reported in compositional table, DLE liberated gas, or MSS liberated gas.

For example:

| Component         | Mole % | Weight % | Molecular weight (g/mol) |
|-------------------|--------:|----------:|---------------------------:|
| n-Pentane         | 0.236   | 0.806     | 72.15 |
| Hexanes, C6 total | 0.273   | 1.087     | 84.2  |
| n-Hexane          | 0.086   | 0.351     | 86.2  |
| iso-Paraffins     | 0.154   | 0.627     | 86.2  |
| Naphthenes        | 0.033   | 0.109     | 70.1  |
| Heptanes, C7 total| 0.199   | 0.837     | 88.9  |
| n-Heptane         | 0.014   | 0.067     | 100.2 |
| iso-Paraffins     | 0.038   | 0.181     | 100.2 |
| Naphthenes        | 0.116   | 0.476     | 86.6  |
| Aromatics         | 0.030   | 0.112     | 78.1  |

You see for every C6 total and C7 total, there are iso-Paraffins (P), Naphthenes (N), and Aromatics (A).

Remove these PNA, so you just have C6 total and C7 total.

| Component         | Mole % | Weight % | Molecular weight (g/mol) |
|-------------------|--------:|----------:|---------------------------:|
| n-Pentane         | 0.236   | 0.806     | 72.15 |

            |   550 (P_RES) |   0.7         |

            |   450         |   0.9         |
            |   400 (P_BP)  |   1.0         |
            |   350         |   1.1         |                
       - DO NOT EXTRACT DATA IF PAGE CONTAINS FIGURE (OR GRAPH). See Instruction 4.

       - If the columns like this: 2600 psia, 2010 psia, 1000 psia, Residual Oil
          - Put the pressures columns inside Liberated Gas schema
          - Put the Residual Oil column inside Final Stage Oil schema

       - Liberated Gas structure:
          - Put each of the "pressure" inside "stages" key
          - Put ALL the "components" and its "molar_amount" inside each "pressure" which it refers to
